subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text:
* In mainland China, Hong Kong and Korean {{w|hanja}}, the middle top component is written {{l|mul|同}}.
* In Taiwan (based on its {{w|zh:國字標準字體|standardized form of characters}}), the middle top component is written {{l|mul|⿵[[冂]][[〒]]}}.
* In Japanese {{w|kanji}}, the middle top component is written {{l|mul|⿵[[冂]]⿱[[一]][[コ]]}}, which is the historical form found in the {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}.

subSections.title: Han character
subSections.text: {{Han char|rn=96|rad=玉|as=14|asm=15|sn=19|snm=20|four=77103|canj=HBMGI|ids=⿳⿴𦥑同冖玉(GHK),⿳⿴𦥑⿵冂〒冖玉(T),⿳⿴𦥑⿵冂⿱一コ冖玉(J)}}
